page.title: 12FARMING-2. THE WHOLE AREA
page.content:
Of the farms in the area,some are {tenant farms}and others are farmed by the{landowner}himself.They range in size from 53.75,to 480 acres.
Most farms concentrate on{arable } farming, although some have{dairy } herds(mainly those on the lower ground).Some farms are{mixed,}that is,either arable and dairy or arable and sheep farming.
{Crops}that are grown are wheat, barley,some oats,oil seed rape and grass for silage or hay.
{Livestock}include cattle(milking and beef),sheep and sometimes goats.The milking herds include Friesian and the beef cattle,Charolais or Limousins.The types of sheep include Mashams,Mules and Swaledales.
